title: Sarah Ferguson wows in a vibrant scarf for a night out in London
text:
The Duchess of York showcased her fashion prowess when stepping out in London, last night.

Sarah Ferguson, 59, commanded attention in a vibrant scarf teamed with a pair of her favourite black velvet slippers with a shimmering pink crown embellished on each shoe.

The ex-wife of Prince Andrew, the Queen's second son, who is better known as 'Fergie', was spotted making her way home from an evening outing at Annabel's private members club in the British capital.

Her appearance comes after she revealed she shed 'tears of joys' after her eldest daughter Princess Beatrice, 31, announced her engagement to property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi.

The Duchess of York showcases her fashion prowess when stepping out in London, last night

Looking a picture of sophistication, the mother-of-two donned an demure knee-length black frock for her evening out.

She completed the ensemble with black tights, before adding a little glitz with a pair of pearl drop earrings.

Wearing her trademark slippers, the comfortable flats are a staple of the Duchess' wardrobe and she appears to have many different variations of the on-trend shoe in her closet.

Sarah Ferguson, 59, commands attention in a vibrant scarf teamed with a pair of her favourite black velvet slippers with a shimmering pink crown embellished on each shoe

Sarah kept her red hair in a simple straight down 'do and added a smattering of glamorous makeup to her features.

Often spotted out and about with her daughters Eugenie, 29, and Beatrice, Fergie seemed to be flying solo as she emerged from the exclusive club to head home.

Princess Beatrice, 31, and property tycoon Edoardo, 36, announced their engagement via Buckingham Palace two weeks ago.

After their friendship developed into a romance following Princess Eugenie's wedding, Beatrice was understood to have introduced Edoardo, whose father is Count Alessandro Mapelli Mozzi, as her 'boyfriend' to the Duke and Duchess of York.

Princess Beatrice, 31, and property tycoon Edoardo, 36, announced their engagement last Thursday

Sarah, pictured with Princess Beatrice waving to daughter Princess Eugenie on her wedding day in October last year, said she shed tears of joy at the news of her eldest's engagement

Edoardo is the son of former Olympic skier Count Alessandro Mapelli Mozzi and Nikki Shale, and has been a friend of the Yorks for some time.

Their engagement after an 11-month romance means that Beatrice will be the first among the young generation of royals to take on a stepchild, as Edoardo was previously engaged for three-and-a-half years to the mother of his child, Dara Huang, whom he split from last year.

After hearing news of the engagement, the Duchess of York revealed she shed 'tears of joy'.

Speaking of the happy news, she wrote on social media: 'I know what mother feels so I have tears of joy. I am so proud of this sensational news. Andrew and I are just the luckiest people ever to have two great son-in-laws.'
description: The ex-wife of Prince Andrew, who is better known as 'Fergie', 59, was spotted making her way home from an evening outing at Annabel's private members club in London last night.
